metadata.title: Lines and Angles for Kids
metadata.description: Interactive questions to build understanding of basic geometry concepts
metadata.author: Math Educator

questions.question: All angles are measured from 0° to ____.
questions.explanation: Angles can measure up to 360° (a full circle).

questions.question: Vertex of angle is?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 200'><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='150' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='3' fill='red'/><text x='80' y='120' font-size='12'>A</text><text x='40' y='40' font-size='12'>B</text><text x='160' y='40' font-size='12'>C</text></svg>
questions.explanation: The vertex is point A where the two lines meet.

questions.question: Which angle is a straight angle?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 300 100'><line x1='50' y1='50' x2='100' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='50' x2='150' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='50' x2='250' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='250' y1='50' x2='250' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The first angle forms a straight line (180°).

questions.question: A straight angle measures:
questions.explanation: A straight angle forms a straight line and measures exactly 180°.

questions.question: A straight angle looks like a perfectly straight line.
questions.explanation: When two rays point in exactly opposite directions, they form a straight line (180°).

questions.question: Which angle is acute?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 300 100'><line x1='50' y1='70' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='70' x2='100' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='150' y1='70' x2='200' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='70' x2='180' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='250' y1='70' x2='300' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='300' y1='70' x2='300' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The second angle is smaller than 90°, making it acute.

questions.question: An angle measuring 100° is obtuse.
questions.explanation: 100° is between 90° and 180°, so it's obtuse.

questions.question: Which angle is obtuse?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 300 100'><line x1='50' y1='70' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='70' x2='100' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='150' y1='70' x2='200' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='70' x2='220' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='250' y1='70' x2='300' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='300' y1='70' x2='300' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The second angle is wider than 90° but less than 180°, making it obtuse.

questions.question: A reflex angle measures:
questions.explanation: Reflex angles are the larger angles that measure more than 180° but less than 360°.

questions.question: A 270° angle is a reflex angle.
questions.explanation: 270° is between 180° and 360°, so it's reflex.

questions.question: Angle L AOC =
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 130 130'><style>.line { stroke: black; stroke-width: 1.5; fill: none; }.point { font-family: Arial; font-size: 10px; font-weight: bold; }.point-marker { fill: red; r: 2; }.angle-label { font-size: 8px; }</style><path fill='rgba(100,200,255,0.3)' d='M 10 110 L 10 20 L 60 33.4 Z'/><path fill='rgba(200,100,255,0.3)' d='M 10 110 L 60 33.4 L 110 110 Z'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='10' y2='20' class='line'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='60' y2='33.4' class='line'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='110' y2='110' class='line'/><circle cx='10' cy='110' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='5' y='120' class='point'>O</text><circle cx='10' cy='20' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='13' y='23' class='point'>A</text><circle cx='60' cy='33.4' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='63' y='36.4' class='point'>B</text><circle cx='110' cy='110' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='105' y='105' class='point'>C</text><text x='20' y='70' class='angle-label'>30°</text><text x='50' y='90' class='angle-label'>45°</text></svg>

questions.question: What is common between LAOC and LBOD
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 130 130'><style>.point { font-family: Arial; font-size: 10px; }.angle-fill { fill: rgba(100,200,255,0.5); stroke: none; }.point-marker { fill: red; r: 2; }</style><path class='angle-fill' d='M 10 120 L 86.6 55.7 L 103.97 85.8 Z'/><line x1='10' y1='120' x2='10' y2='20' style='stroke:red;stroke-width:2'/><line x1='10' y1='120' x2='86.6' y2='55.7' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2'/><line x1='10' y1='120' x2='103.97' y2='85.8' style='stroke:red;stroke-width:2'/><line x1='10' y1='120' x2='110' y2='120' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2'/><circle cx='10' cy='120' r='2' /><text x='5' y='130' class='point'>O</text><circle cx='10' cy='20' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='13' y='23' class='point'>A</text><circle cx='86.6' cy='55.7' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='89.6' y='58.7' class='point'>B</text><circle cx='103.97' cy='85.8' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='106.97' y='88.8' class='point'>C</text><circle cx='110' cy='120' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='113' y='123' class='point'>D</text></svg>
questions.explanation: The small black dot on the left is how we represent a point.

questions.question: Choose the correct option
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 130 130'><style>.point { font-family: Arial; font-size: 10px; }.angle-fill { fill: rgba(100,200,255,0.5); stroke: none; }.point-marker { fill: red; r: 2; }</style><path class='angle-fill' d='M 10 120 L 86.6 55.7 L 103.97 85.8 Z'/><line x1='10' y1='120' x2='10' y2='20' style='stroke:red;stroke-width:2'/><line x1='10' y1='120' x2='86.6' y2='55.7' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2'/><line x1='10' y1='120' x2='103.97' y2='85.8' style='stroke:red;stroke-width:2'/><line x1='10' y1='120' x2='110' y2='120' style='stroke:blue;stroke-width:2'/><circle cx='10' cy='120' r='2' /><text x='5' y='130' class='point'>O</text><circle cx='10' cy='20' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='13' y='23' class='point'>A</text><circle cx='86.6' cy='55.7' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='89.6' y='58.7' class='point'>B</text><circle cx='103.97' cy='85.8' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='106.97' y='88.8' class='point'>C</text><circle cx='110' cy='120' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='113' y='123' class='point'>D</text></svg>
questions.explanation: The small black dot on the left is how we represent a point.

questions.question: Arrange these angles in increasing order:
